Row.Text: Garrosh Hellscream was the son of Grom Hellscream and former chieftain of the Warsong clan. With the reopening of the Dark Portal, Garrosh was invited into the Horde by Thrall himself, quickly advancing to the position of personal adviser of the Warchief. Garrosh led the Horde troops into Northrend and was given the position of acting Warchief in Thrall's absence.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for all melee units.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on a continent other that your [ICON_Capital] Capital's.
Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Culture] Culture on combat victory
Faster movement in Woods and Jungle terrain. Can see through Woods and Jungle.

The shadow hunter Vol'jin, son of Sen'jin, Chieftain of the Darkspear tribe. Vol'jin had sworn to do everything in his power to lead the Darkspear tribe just as his late father, Sen'jin, would have. For years Vol'jin resided in Orgrimmar, offering strategic advice to then-Warchief Thrall and assisting with critical operations such as retaking the Undercity after the Forsaken bastion had been usurped by Grand Apothecary Putress and the dreadlord Varimathras.
All units gains additional +5 [ICON_Strength] when fighting in Forest or Jungle.
Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Culture] Faith on combat victory

Baine Bloodhoof is the current High Chieftain of the Tauren, son of the aging Cairne Bloodhoof and Tamaala, Baine fought alongside his father with pride and respect, and continued to defend his people when they established a home for themselves in Mulgore.
Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.
Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.

Sylvanas Windrunner is the former Ranger-General of Silvermoon. She currently serves as leader of the Forsaken faction of undead. Sylvanas was able to claim Lordaeron and made her home under the former Capital City, naming it "The Undercity."
-5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength to adjacent enemy units.

Lor'themar Theron is the Regent Lord of Quel'Thalas, and was the leader of the blood elves of Azeroth in the absence of Prince Kael'thas Sunstrider. After Kael'thas' betrayal and eventual death, Lor'themar has become the sole leader of his people and seeks to lead them to a brighter future.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs Ranged Units and +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending vs. ranged attacks.
Heals every turn, even after moving or combat.

Jastor Gallywix is the much-maligned Trade Prince of the Bilgewater Cartel, one of the most powerful goblin trade guilds on Kezan. Despite betraying his own people in a petty act of vengeance, he retains his position as Trade Prince of the Bilgewater Cartel in its service to the Horde.

Varian Wrynn, was the son of the late King Llane Wrynn, was the acting leader of the Alliance, and the former King of Stormwind. Under his leadership, the humans of Stormwind led the Alliance to victory against the Lich King in Northrend, and now seek to bolster their strategic holdings against their perennial enemy, "the Horde".
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on a continent other that your [ICON_Capital] Capital's.

Muradin Bronzebeard is a hero of the Alliance, the younger brother of the dwarven King Magni Bronzebeard and the older brother of the renowned explorer Brann Bronzebeard. Muradin was believed to have perished in Northrend when the young prince Arthas Menethil claimed the runeblade Frostmourne. Magni was turned to stone after performing a ritual in Old Ironforge; Muradin, his daughter Moira and Thane Falstad Wildhammer succeeded him as leaders of the dwarves, ruling from the High Seat.

Tyrande Whisperwind is the most prominent night elf leader, as the chosen high priestess of the goddess Elune, the former general of the night elf sentinels, and the current head of the Sisterhood of Elune. Together with her lifelong mate, the Archdruid Malfurion Stormrage, she has represented the highest leadership of the night elves since the fall of Queen Azshara and the Highborne caste ten thousand years ago.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when in your territory or adjacent to your territory.

Velen has been the leader of the draenei people since their flight from Argus 25,000 years before the first orcish invasion of Azeroth. As his title entails, he has been granted the gift of prophecy, and — aided by the Light — has guided his people as they fled from, and later fought against, the Burning Legion who had ensnared their eredar brethren.
Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Faith] Faith on combat victory and heals every turn, even after moving or combat.
Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.

Lord Genn Greymane is the king of the nation and kingdom of Gilneas. Time and again, King Genn Greymane has been forced to make difficult decisions to sustain Gilneas’s well-being and autonomy. Following the Second War, he ordered the construction of the seemingly impenetrable Greymane Wall to protect his people from outside threats, effectively closing off the nation from the world and its petty conflicts.
Melee units can move after attacking.

High Tinker Gelbin Mekkatorque. The highest office in Gnomeregan, High Tinker, has been held by the crafty Gelbin Mekkatorque for the past seven to nine years. Gelbin is one of the most renowned inventors ever
Faster than the Horseman and even faster if it starts in open terrain.

Highlord Tirion Fordring was the Supreme Commander of the Argent Crusade and the bearer of the Ashbringer. One of the first five Knights of the Silver Hand selected by Archbishop Alonsus Faol, Fordring was one of the Alliance heroes of the Second War. Argent Crusade, an organization consisting of the old Knights of the Silver Hand and the Argent Dawn. Tirion led his new Crusade into battle against the Scourge during the invasion of Northrend
This unit does not suffer combat penalties when damaged and heals after defeating an enemy unit.

The Lich King is the master and lord of the Scourge, which he rules telepathically from the Frozen Throne atop the Icecrown Glacier. Kil'jaeden created the Lich King from the spirit of the orc shaman Ner'zhul to raise an undead army to conquer Azeroth for the Burning Legion. Initially trapped within the Frozen Throne with Frostmourne, the Lich King eventually betrayed Kil'jaeden and merged with the human Arthas Menethil.
Heals after defeating an enemy unit.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in Tundra or Snow.

Zul'jin was the Warlord of the Amani forest trolls and chieftain of the Amani tribe since before the Second War. Zul'jin was a fierce enemy of the high elves, with whom he shared many years of conflict. Zul'jin and the Amani tribe were allied with the orcish Horde for the duration of the Second War, but Zul'jin himself was captured. Upon gaining his freedom, he went into hiding to rebuild his army and plan an attack on the remnants of the high elves, now known as blood elves, only to find them allied with the reformed Horde.
Jin'do was a Gurubashi troll Witch doctor of considerable power.
Frost King Malakk is the leader of the ice trolls of Gundrak.
King Rastakhan rests on a golden throne, lording over all of the Zandalari. Empowered by the Zandalari Gods themseves to act as their voice, he has ruled over two hundred years.
Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Faith] Faith on combat victory.
Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Faith] Faith on combat victory.
Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Faith] Faith on combat victory.
Yields 15% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Science] Science on combat victory.
Yields 50% of defeated units' [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength as [ICON_Gold] Gold on combat victory.
When defeating an enemy unit, spread their religion to nearby cities.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when there is an Apostle, Inquisitor, or Missionary in the same hex.
This unit heals every turn, even after moving or combat.
Less ranged attack but with more movement and can move after attacking.
This unit heals after defeating an enemy unit.
-50% war weariness from combat in your territory.
All districts gain +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for being adjacent to the Coast.
All districts gain +1 [ICON_Science] Science for being adjacent to the Coast.

Your districts provide +1 [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person point of their type ([ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer, [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist, and [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician for Theater Square districts).

City Center buildings and Encampment district buildings can be bought with [ICON_Faith] Faith. Cost of purchasing Ancient, Medieval, and Renaissance Walls is reduced, but they can only be bought with [ICON_Faith] Faith.
All districts gain +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for being adjacent to the Coast.
All districts gain +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for being adjacent to the Coast.
+3 [ICON_Production] Production in Industrial Zones for adjecency to a Marsh.
+3 [ICON_Production] Production in Industrial Zones for adjecency to a Marsh.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production in Industrial Zones for adjecency to a Desert.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production in Industrial Zones for adjecency to a Tundra.
Receive a [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic every time you discover a new natural wonder, and earn +50% [ICON_Faith] Faith from all [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relics.
+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for routes between your own cities.
+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for Desert in Holy Sites.
+1 [ICON_Science] Science for Coasts tiles in Harbors.
All districts gain +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for being adjacent to the Coast.
Your Encampment districts provide +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity each.
+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture in Enchament District for adjecency to a Mountain.
+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith in Holy Sites for adjecency to a Mountain.
City State of Peak of Serenity
+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith in Holy Sites for adjecency to a River.
+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith in Holy Sites for adjecency to a Hill.
+1 [ICON_Science] Science in Campus for adjecency to a River.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for melee units in Desert tiles.
Your units receive double experience from battles they initiate.
Melee units gain 50% more experience than usual.
All districts adyacent to a lake get +1 [ICON_Science] Science
+6 City defense strength, +5 City ranged attack strength.
+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for Coast tiles in Encampents.
+20% Production toward Melee units from all the eras since the Classical Era.
Unit maintenance cost reduced by 2 Gold per turn, per unit.
+2 [ICON_Production] Production in every Encampment district when producing units
+2 Amenity for cities with a garrisoned unit.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to any city-state provide +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every specialty district in the origin city.
Receive a [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic every time you discover a new natural wonder, and earn +50% [ICON_Faith] Faith from all [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relics.
One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +2 [ICON_Production] Production to adjacent tiles.
“Have you heard the rumblings? The Mountain stirs once more, beneath its crags cliffs and rocks. There's evil in its core, fire made flesh.”
One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food to adjacent tiles.

“The night elf army was pushed back through Un'Goro Crater, to the borders of the Tanaris desert. Something in Un'Goro prevented the Qiraji from being able to take the land. I do not quite understand this word but I believe it to mean 'God Lands'. It is stated that they could not 'take the God Lands'.”[NEWLINE]– Geologist Larksbane
One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to adjacent tiles.
Lost Peak is the gigantic volcano at the center of the Lost Isles. After Volcanoth! the Lost Peak is turned into a fiery, lava-drenched wasteland.
One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Production] Production to adjacent tiles.

Mount Kajaro is a mountain volcano on the Isle of Kezan. It is a still-active volcano, and kaja'mite was mined underneath it. According to Al'tabim the All-Seeing, Kajaro is an area plagued by volatility, marked by violent and oftentimes magical volcanic eruptions.
Two tile natural wonder that can be found on coastal terrain and provides +3 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Science] Science.
Once a great Highborne city housing some of the most revered night elves of Kalimdor, Vashj'ir was swallowed by the Great Sea in the Sundering and thought to be lost forever.
Two tile natural wonder that can be found on coastal terrain and provides +1 [ICON_Science] Science to adjacent tiles.

The Maelstrom is a massive, fierce vortex of water that was created when the Well of Eternity collapsed into itself during the Great Sundering. It is located in the middle of the Great Sea which subsequently filled the void. The water churns constantly in a dizzying storm of tidal and arcane energy that seems to have no end.
Two tile natural wonder that can be found on coastal terrain and provides +2 [ICON_Science] Science to adjacent tiles.

The original Well of Eternity was formed from a great wound in Azeroth's surface, created when Aman'Thul, the Highfather of the titan Pantheon, ripped the Old God Y'Shaarj from the world's crust and tore it apart. The volatile arcane lifeblood of Azeroth's world-soul rushed to the surface and roiled over the world. It was through this event that the Pantheon realized that the Old Gods had embedded themselves too deep in Azeroth's surface to remove without severely harming the world-soul, and so they instead resolved to imprison the vile entities below the surface of the world.
Three tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to adjacent tiles.

Few places in Azeroth are as beautiful, or as perilous, as Highmountain. Its rugged slopes teem with wild beasts, roaring waterfalls, and breathtaking views. A vast network of caverns winds through the mountain's heart, holding legendary treasures and secrets from Azeroth's distant past.
Three tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles.

The Kaldorei have long held this great mountain sacred. When the first Well of Eternity was destroyed in the first demonic invasion, the resulting implosion triggered a cataclysm that made the world shudder. Mount Hyjal endured, however, and the night elves emerged to rebuild their society — though without arcane magic this time.
Three tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Food] Food to adjacent tiles.
Mount Mugamba is the sacred mountain of Zandalar. The tombs of Atal'Dazar are secluded high atop Mugamba.
Three tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to adjacent tiles.
Mount Neverest is the highest mountain in Kun-Lai Summit and all of Azeroth.
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
“How fortuitous. Usually, I must leave my lair in order to feed.”[NEWLINE]– Onyxia
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles.

Ten thousand years ago - during the War of the Ancients, the mighty demigod, Agamaggan, came forth to battle the Burning Legion. Though the colossal boar fell in combat, his actions helped save Azeroth from ruin. Yet over time, in the areas where his blood fell, massive thorn-ridden vines sprouted from the earth. The quilboar - believed to be the mortal offspring of the mighty god, came to occupy these regions and hold them sacred.
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_Science] Science.

In years past, a night elf druid named Naralex discovered a network of underground caverns within the heart of the Barrens. Naralex believed he could use the caverns' underground springs to restore lushness and fertility to the Barrens - but to do so would require siphoning the energies of the fabled Emerald Dream. Once connected to the Dream however, the druid's vision somehow became a nightmare. Soon the Wailing Caverns began to change - the waters turned foul and the once-docile creatures inside metamorphosed into vicious, deadly predators.
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +5 [ICON_Faith] Faith.

Protected by the fierce Maraudine centaur, Maraudon is one of the most sacred sites within Desolace. The great temple/cavern is the burial place of Zaetar, one of two immortal sons born to the demigod, Cenarius. Legend holds that Zaetar and the earth elemental princess, Theradras, sired the misbegotten centaur race. It is said that upon their emergence, the barbaric centaur turned on their father and killed him. Some believe that Theradras, in her grief, trapped Zaetar's spirit within the winding cavern - used its energies for some malign purpose. The subterranean tunnels are populated by the vicious, long-dead ghosts of the Centaur Khans, as well as Theradras' own raging, elemental minions.
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +2 [ICON_Production].

It is said the Deadmines' gold deposits once accounted for a third of Stormwind's treasure reserves. Amid the chaos of the First War, the mines were abandoned and later thought to be haunted, leaving them relatively untouched until the Defias Brotherhood, a group of former laborers turned brigands, claimed the labyrinth as a base of operations for its subversive activities against Stormwind.
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +4 [ICON_Science] Science.

The Caverns of Time are home to Nozdormu and the bronze dragonflight. It is their sacred mission, one which was charged to them by the titans, to guard the caverns against the intrusion of mortals, whose interference would assuredly disrupt the flow of time. Recently, a mysterious force called the infinite dragonflight has begun to meddle with time.
Two tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith.

Grizzlemaw, formerly known as Vordrassil, was a failed attempt at a World Tree, located in the Grizzly Hills of southern Northrend. The Old God Yogg-Saron sleeps beneath its roots, and appears to have been responsible for the corruption of the furbolg. Yogg-Saron's corruption was also the motivation for the destruction of Vordrassil.
